text: hey everyone Anthony Fantino here
Internet's busiest music nerd and it is
time for a review of the new passage de
verre record in vault this is the latest
full-length LP from one of Switzerland's
longest-running and most well respected
black metal exports massage de verre
which upon release has been celebrated
as the 2020 crown jewel of black metal
masterminded by multi-instrumentalist
vocalist and songwriter vin thir this
project has been running since the late
90s and has released well over a dozen
splits and albums and EPS since then and
this latest one has been a long time
coming since 2013's das tour was the
only record that pace aaj dropped in the
2010s it was an album that did make some
noise in the American underground as
well as during that time all of this
atmospheric black metal and black gaze
was popping off over here and passagio
vert is no stranger to atmosphere and
ambience so now with this new record out
I'm sure hardcore fans have their
fingers crossed for a long winter this
year so that they can hibernate with
this thing it is too full freakin hours
long with nothing but expansive black
metal odyssey's interrupted by these
ambient leaning filled recording backed
interludes but to be honest in my
opinion I think a lot of the creative
sound play and compositional work that
painted previous releases previous
classic releases have not shown up as
strong on this new release for one I
think this is the most uninteresting
sounding album that passaggio vert has
put out in a long time on the surface
sonically this seems like your typical
low five black metal affair very
distorted very brittle very thin seems
almost basic but then it becomes even
more disappointing as I listen further
and I realize not much as translating
from these recordings other than these
very muddy droning guitars which have a
lot less bite than they have had on
previous efforts and it's not even
simply that these are low fidelity
recordings there are tons of amazing
classic black metal records that are low
fidelity this project is responsible for
some of them the sonic clarity of the
recordings here isn't as much the issue
as these tracks
losing shape for me as I listen to them
just kind of turning into background
noise the further they grind on which
can even happen on a high-fidelity
recording and in my opinion this is a
pretty strong contrast from the multiple
recordings from da store where the drums
guitars and vocals are all pretty
clearly defined however the production
on involved by comparison feels a lot
more constrained and OneNote more slushy
than I would say wintry take the song
alt for example the guitars on this
track are just pure static the vocals
are so burnt they're barely there and
then the drums sound like what you would
get if you're just ferociously banging
on wooden boxes then the atmospheric
synthesizer is thrown into the mix are
just so ill-defined they're melting into
themselves and adding basically nothing
it's like spilling water color all over
a piece that was pretty impressionistic
to begin with now there is at least some
semblance of sonic variety amongst the
records core songs the opening track
features some very tight keyboard runs
that were totally unexpected they sound
like a sped up version of something that
you might hear off the old school prog
synth epic then there is la revolution
is the most ferocious sounding song and
the entire record this one really has a
bite to the guitars care to shower
features some pretty atmospheric synth
passages on the back end that aren't bad
there is also some ghoulish shouting in
the second half of Shimon involved which
sounds like a voice reverberating up
from a dungeon these moments and others
do create some touch stones across the
record but never are they enough to make
a single song interesting from front to
back which leads me to some of the more
compositional elements of this LP the
riffs the lead melodies the chord
progressions that are worked into these
tracks too in my opinion this batch is
not fresh the riffs and leads performed
throughout this LP sound like some of
the most tired lo-fi black metal cliches
I've heard stretched so thin they could
go around the earth twice the slow and
brooding riff on the track v thir MOV
tour is so mind-numbing and so basic as
it drags on and on and on it feels like
I'm experiencing a tinnitus simulator
these really are some of the most
tedious and unimaginable
riffs and melodies I've heard in a while
the only melody that to me on this
entire record that felt remotely
I don't know memorable was on the intro
to steamin involved that I mentioned
earlier now looking at the tracklist for
this LP you would think that for a
moment you could take solace in the fact
that these ambient interludes are gonna
create some diversity across the LP some
separation between these tracks these
interludes will provide some kind of
much-needed variety but pretty much all
of them are painted by what sounds like
the same noisy cyclical field recording
going on just grinding on in the
background over and over and over which
just comes off distracting unnecessary
and adding to this records severe
feeling of redundancy this record
finishes off with a 19-minute grand
finale the song so halt is V there which
I do give credit for having more sonic
space than a majority of the other
tracks here but that comes mostly by way
of this groaning and droning reverb
guitar riff that sort of plays over the
core instrumental not really connecting
with it in any significant way while
sonically there is this extra dynamic
component to it that's good
compositionally it's not really all that
much greater than anything else here so
overall I'm just getting so little out
of this unfortunately I'm not really
hearing what makes this one of the best
black metal releases of 2020 or what
makes this one of the best pay sajdah
vert projects in general in fact it
actually kind of reminds me of previous
releases like knocked which in my
opinion was similarly packed with
uninspired chord progressions and a lot
of sonic haze the most major difference
I'm hearing here is that involved is
stretched out over a very arduous two
hours feeling a light two DS and three
on this one transition have you given
this album a listen did you love it did
you hate it what would you rate it
you're the best you're the best what
should I review next hit the like if you
like please subscribe and please don't
cry hit the bell as well over here next
to my head is another video that you can
check out hit that up or the link to
subscribe to the channel Anthony Fantana
passaggio ver forever
